markdown.markdown:
1. Submit on [Gradescope](https://www.gradescope.com/courses/1057811)
2. You can find all assignments **(and posted solutions)** on [Datahub](https://datahub.berkeley.edu/hub/user-redirect/git-pull?repo=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fberkeley-stat131a%2Fsummer-2025-assignments%2F&urlpath=rstudio%2F&branch=main)
Or you can look at the [Github repository](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments) directly.

| Assignment | Due date | Solution\* |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Course Pre-Survey | Tue June 24 11:59pm | n/a |
| Lab 00 - RStudio Intro | Tue June 24 11:59pm | n/a |
| Lab 01 - Data Visualization | Mon June 30 11:59pm | [pdf](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments/blob/main/lab01/Lab01_Solution.pdf) |
| Lab 02 - Data Wrangling | Tue July 1 11:59pm | [pdf](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments/blob/main/lab02/Lab02_Solution.pdf) |
| Lab 03 - Permutation Testing| Wed July 8 11:59pm | [pdf](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments/blob/main/lab03/Lab03_Solution.pdf) |
| Lab 04 - Randomness and Distributions | Thu July 9 11:59pm | [pdf](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments/blob/main/lab04/Lab04_Solution.pdf) |
| Lab 05 - What's going on in NYC? | Sat July 12 11:59pm | [pdf](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments/blob/main/lab05/Lab05_Solution.pdf) |
| Worksheet - Dog Breeds | Sun July 13 11:59pm | - |
| Lab 06 - Correlation | Sun July 20 11:59pm | - |
| Probability Quick Practice | (Ungraded, no submission) | [doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1aFSim4bXrQ_8p2kAfYlhBnWB9esdd2_2z7c4Aazuwxo/edit?usp=sharing) |
| Midterm | (in-class Thu July 17) | [pdf](https://github.com/berkeley-stat131a/summer-2025-assignments/blob/main/exams/midterm/MidtermSolution.pdf) |
| Lab 07 - Post-Midterm Practice | Sun July 27 | - |
| Lab 08 - Intro to Modeling | Tue July 29 | - |
| Dataset Finding | Fri Aug 1 | See [Ed](https://edstem.org/us/courses/80202/discussion/6843580) |
| Lab 09 - Regression | Fri Aug 1 | - |
| Lab 10 - Getting acquainted with your data | Mon Aug 4 | n/a |

\* I call these "solutions," but there are always many ways to solve any problem. Don't look at these as "THE right way" to do it, just one way that you might learn something from.
